alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 4:37AM EST until January 25 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. Lower Roanoke River At Roanoke Rapids affecting Northampton and Halifax Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River at Smithfield. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 11.1 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Sat Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 15.3 Tue 4 am EST 15.3 14.9 13.8 11.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 445 PM EST.
